intro: Heracleum microcarpum, commonly known as small-fruited cowparn. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its tall, branched stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers in umbels, which are typical of the carrot family. Its fruits are small, dry, and contain a single seed, contributing to its classification as a member of the Umbelliferae tribe. Heracleum microcarpum is typically found in moist, open habitats such as meadows and streambanks.
